com.camerontec.util.data

Class AbstractSafeBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.data.AbstractBuffer
      • com.camerontec.util.data.AbstractSafeBuffer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Buffer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SafeBufferOnByteArray, SafeBufferOnByteBuffer

    public abstract class AbstractSafeBuffer
extends AbstractBuffer
    Base class for safe Buffer implementations.

    In this context, a safe Buffer implementation is any which guarantees not to make use of any sun.misc.Unsafe operations.

    This class is responsible for bounds checking and then delegates to subclasses to implement the actual put/get operations. Implementations of this class are expected to be layered on top of a fixed size buffer of some kind.

    See Also:
    UnsafeBuffer

        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Copy all available bytes, from the specified index, into the target buffer.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        target - The target buffer.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied. This can be smaller than the available bytes available if the target buffer does not have sufficient capacity.

      • getBytes

        public final int getBytes(int index,
                          byte[] target,
                          int offset,
                          int length)
        Description copied from interface: Buffer
        Copy up to length bytes, from the specified index, into the target buffer starting at the specified offset.
        Parameters:
        index - The index.
        target - The target buffer.
        offset - The target buffer offset.
        length - The maximum number of bytes to copy.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes copied. This can be smaller than length if there were fewer bytes available in the buffer.
